Methods

AddBar(DateTime, double, double, in Quantity, DateTime)

Adds new bar into storage Only open and close values are specified. High and low are calculated from open and close

protected void AddBar(DateTime time, double open, double close, in Quantity volume, DateTime tickTime)

Parameters

time DateTime

A DateTime value representing the time

open double

A double value representing the open price

close double

A double value representing the close price

volume Quantity

A long value representing the volume

tickTime DateTime

The last known tick time inside the bar. The tick time must be greater or equal than the time of the bar

NewBar(DateTime, double, double, double, double, in Quantity)

Receives the next portion of data The data can be represented as already generated bar, with formed open, high, low and close values, or it can be a tick with current price only The inheritors must handle both cases. In general, bar data can be introduced as 4 ticks, for open, high, low and close prices. But, if we have input data already presented as OHLC bar, it is rather inefficient to generate 4 calls. Thus, it was decided to make this handler support both data types: bar and tick

public void NewBar(DateTime time, double open, double high, double low, double close, in Quantity volume)

Parameters

time DateTime

Time of thr bar or tick

open double

Open price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

high double

High price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

low double

Low price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

close double

Close price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

volume Quantity

Volume of the bar. If data is tick, then this is volume of tick

OnDataPoint(DateTime, double, double, double, double, in Quantity, bool)

Receives the next portion of data The data can be represented as already generated bar, with formed open, high, low and close values, or it can be a tick with current price only The inheritors must handle both cases. In general, bar data can be introduced as 4 ticks, for open, high, low and close prices. But, if we have input data already presented as OHLC bar, it is rather inefficient to generate 4 calls. Thus, it was decided to make this handler support both data types: bar and tick When data is a bar (isBar is true), you have to process a open, high, low and close otherwise you can process close only

protected abstract void OnDataPoint(DateTime time, double open, double high, double low, double close, in Quantity volume, bool isBar)

Parameters

time DateTime

Time of thr bar or tick

open double

Open price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

high double

High price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

low double

Low price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

close double

Close price of the bar. If data is tick, then open=high=low=close=current tick price

volume Quantity

Volume of the bar. If data is tick, then this is volume of tick

isBar bool

If true, then passed data is bar, with formed OHLC, otherwise, only close must be considered (other prices will be equal to close)

Reset()

Resets the internal state of builder. This method must be called if builder starts working from the scratch

public virtual void Reset()

UpdateLastBar(double, in Quantity, DateTime)

Updates last bar with new close price. Pay attention that high and low ofd the last bar may be also modified if new close is out of high-low ranges

protected void UpdateLastBar(double close, in Quantity volumeAdded, DateTime tickTime)

Parameters

close double
volumeAdded Quantity
tickTime DateTime

UpdateLastBar(double, double, double, in Quantity, DateTime)

Updates last bar with new incoming values. Pay attention that incoming data is summed up with previous data: new high will be max of incoming high and previous high, new low will be min of incoming low and previous low, the incoming volume will be added to existing

protected void UpdateLastBar(double high, double low, double close, in Quantity volumeAdded, DateTime tickTime)

Parameters

high double
low double
close double
volumeAdded Quantity
tickTime DateTime
